content.question: The writer is considering adding the clause “devices that work optimally only for a few years before bugs in their programming introduce glitches and errors” to the end of sentence 6, adjusting the punctuation as needed. Should the writer add this clause to the end of sentence 6?

choices.label: Yes, because it demonstrates that Saxe and other city planners are experts on the subject of smart cities who are familiar with the latest technology.
Yes, because the additional information clarifies a comparison to a more familiar technology that also breaks or becomes obsolete relatively quickly.
No, because it makes Saxe seem like a biased observer by portraying her as being opposed to technological innovations of any kind.
No, because the word “bugs” is ambiguous and could confuse readers who are unfamiliar with technological jargon.

content.answer: Yes, because the additional information clarifies a comparison to a more familiar technology that also breaks or becomes obsolete relatively quickly.
